verses.verse: Why do the heathen<WH1471> rage<WH7283>, and the people<WH3816> imagine<WH1897> a vain thing<WH7385>?
The kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> set<WH3320> themselves<WH7336>, and the rulers take counsel<WH3245> together<WH3162>, against the Lord<WH3068>, and against his anointed<WH4899>, saying,
Let us break<WH5423> their bands<WH4147> asunder<WH5423>, and cast away<WH7993> their cords from us<WH5688>.
He that sits<WH3427> in the heavens<WH8064> shall laugh<WH7832>: the Lord<WH136> shall have them in derision<WH3932>.
Then shall he speak<WH1696> unto them in his wrath<WH639>, and trouble<WH926> them in his severe displeasure<WH2740>.
Yet have I set<WH5258> my king<WH4428> upon my holy<WH6944> hill<WH2022> of Zion<WH6726>.
I will declare<WH5608> the decree<WH2706>: the Lord<WH3068> has said<WH559> unto me<WH1121>, You are my Son; this day<WH3117> have I fathered you<WH3205>.
Ask<WH7592> of me<WH5414>, and I shall give you the heathen<WH1471> for your inheritance<WH5159>, and the outermost parts<WH657> of the earth<WH776> for your possession<WH272>.
You shall break<WH7489> them with a rod<WH7626> of iron<WH1270>; you shall dash them in pieces<WH5310> like a potter<WH3335>'s vessel<WH3627>.
Be wise<WH7919> now therefore<WH4428>, O you kings: be instructed<WH3256>, you judges<WH8199> of the earth<WH776>.
Serve<WH5647> the Lord<WH3068> with fear<WH3374>, and rejoice<WH1523> with trembling<WH7461>.

Kiss<WH5401> the Son<WH1248>, lest he be angry<WH599>, and you perish<WH6> from the way<WH1870>, when his wrath<WH639> is kindled<WH1197> but a little<WH4592>. Blessed<WH835> are all they that put their trust in him<WH2620>.
